title: Loan Recovery / Collections Specialist Job at Renda Limited
content:
Renda is a technology solution that aggregates and digitizes access to the end-to-end logistics and fulfillment infrastructure that enables businesses to scale seamlessly and efficiently across Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Loan Recovery / Collections Specialist
Job Location: Ilupeju, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	SCALE is Renda’s Value-Added Services (VAS) and credit platform that powers essential mobility solutions such as vehicle repairs, fueling, insurance, CNG conversion, and financing.
	Through SCALE, we support drivers, fleet owners, and operators with access to tailored financial and operational services.
	We are seeking a diligent and result-oriented Loan Collection/Recovery Specialist to support the timely repayment of loans and enforce agreed repayment terms.
	The ideal candidate will have strong interpersonal skills, persistence, and a commitment to maintaining professionalism while driving results.


Key Responsibilities


	Engage directly with SCALE beneficiaries to recover outstanding loan repayments.
	Educate beneficiaries on repayment terms, timelines, and the implications of default.
	Escalate unresolved or high-risk accounts following internal recovery protocols.
	Collaborate with the finance, risk, and VAS teams to reconcile account statuses.
	Negotiate and document revised payment plans where necessary.
	Maintain accurate logs of repayment efforts and report daily activities.
	Ensure all recovery efforts comply with company policies and regulatory standards.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Loan recovery rate (%).
	Repayment promise-to-actual conversion rate.
	Number of successful recoveries per period.
	Accuracy and timeliness of recovery reports.
	Compliance with escalation and documentation procedures.


Key Qualifications & Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications in a related field.
	5 years of experience in loan collection, debt recovery, or credit control.
	Strong negotiation, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	High level of professionalism, integrity, and persistence.
	Ability to work independently, manage multiple accounts, and meet deadlines.
	Familiarity with basic reporting tools (e.g., Google Sheets, Excel).
	Fluency in English (local language proficiency is an added advantage).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@renda.co using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Tax & Audit Officer Job at Petrogap Oil and Gas Limited
content:
Petrogap Oil and Gas Limited was incorporated as a response to the emerging trends in the dynamic Oil & Gas industry. We are a wholly indigenous company and registered player in the Upstream, Midstream and Downstream sectors of the Oil & Gas industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Tax & Audit Officer

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Tax and Audit Officer is responsible for all tax planning, compliance, and audit functions of the organization.
	The role ensures full compliance with statutory regulations, coordinates external and internal audits, manages tax risks, and advises management on tax strategies to improve financial efficiency and compliance.


Responsibilities
Tax Management:


	Ensure timely and accurate preparation and filing of all tax returns (CIT, VAT, PAYE, WHT, etc.).
	Develop tax planning strategies to optimize tax liabilities within legal bounds.
	Monitor changes in tax laws and assess their impact on the company’s operations.
	Liaise with tax authorities and external tax consultants to resolve tax issues or audits.
	Maintain proper documentation of all tax transactions and correspondence.


Audit Oversight:


	Plan and coordinate internal and external audit processes.
	Liaise with external auditors to ensure timely and accurate completion of statutory audits.
	Review and assess internal controls and recommend improvements.
	Investigate audit findings and implement corrective actions.
	Prepare and present audit reports to senior management.


Compliance and Risk Management:


	Ensure compliance with all applicable local and international financial regulations.
	Identify and assess areas of financial risk and recommend mitigating measures.
	Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry and regulatory developments.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Minimum of 4 – 6 years of experience in tax and audit.
	Professional certification (e.g., ACA, ACCA, ICAN) is required.
	Experience in the oil & gas or manufacturing industry is an added advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	In-depth knowledge of Nigerian tax laws and regulations.
	Strong understanding of audit standards and procedures.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High level of integrity and attention to detail.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in accounting and ERP software (e.g., SAP, Sage, QuickBooks).


Salary
Very Attractive.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers.pgog@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Supply Chain Manager Job at Oilserv Limited
content:
Oilserv Limited is a leading provider of integrated engineering, procurement, construction, installation & commissioning (EPCIC) services and complementary solutions across the asset and program life cycle within the onshore, offshore and subsea market segments of the oil and gas sector. Oilserv Limited was incorporated in 1992 and commenced operations in 1995.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain Manager
Job Location: Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop, improve, and fulfill organizational and functional objectives in procurement and supply.
	Formulate direction, manage change, and lead and influence internal and external procurement and supply stakeholders.
	Oversee the development and execution of project procurement and resource plans.
	Lead procurement teams within the organization, develop procurement strategies and establish best practices.


Job Details


	Ensure that the procurement and supply function aligns with the achievement of the organization's sources of competitive advantage.
	Create and implement appropriate strategies and plans (project procurement and resource plans) with stakeholders to increase value from supply chain management.
	Work with stakeholders to mitigate or manage risks that can impact supply chains.
	Work with stakeholders to eliminate bribery, corruption, and fraud in supply chains.
	Assess and manage stakeholder expectations through a controlled and value-adding process.
	Promote effective relationships with suppliers and internal stakeholders to secure their commitment to processes, systems, practices, and strategy objectives.
	Identify and explore opportunities for globalization in the procurement of goods and services.
	Contribute to the management of the procurement and supply chain function taking steps to mitigate challenges and difficulties in resolving conflict within the organization and with its supply chains.
	Guide stakeholders to use technologies that help effective communication to support the achievement of supply chain business outcomes.
	Demonstrate leadership behaviours and styles to promote procurement and supply chain management with internal and external stakeholders.
	Advise colleagues and other stakeholders on how to promote ethical and sustainable procurement in the organization and its supply chain.
	Advise colleagues and other stakeholders on cultural and social issues that can affect supply chains.
	Evaluate the impact of customs unions, trade areas, and trade blocs on any restrictions or opportunities for global sourcing.
	Identify the potential impact of STEEPLED criteria on the organization and its supply chain and draw up plans to maximize the benefits and mitigate difficulties. Monitor and ensure compliance with the licensing and documentation for imports and exports that affect the organization.
	Provide advice to colleagues and other stakeholders on the impact of tariffs and duties on imports and exports arranging appropriate actions when necessary.


Requirements


	Minimum of 10 years of experience in the procurement function 
	Engineering background is preferred
	MBA is an added advantage
	Must be an MCIPS - Completed level 6 or equivalent


Benefits


	Great work culture and multiple opportunities for growth and self-development. 
	26 days of annual leave, excluding federal public holidays. 
	Health Insurance coverage. 
	Monthly employer pension contribution.

title: Office Assistant Job at Globalclique Resources
content:
Globalclique HR - Our client, Mo Grills, is one of Lagos’ fast-rising culinary brands, known for delivering premium food experiences with unmatched flavor and service. Located in the heart of Ikota, Lekki, they are redefining the casual dining landscape through exceptional customer service and operational excellence.

As part of their expansion, they are seeking a reliable and well-organized candidate to fill the position below:

Job Position: Office Assistant

Job Location: Ikota, Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The ideal candidate is dependable, detail-oriented, and able to multitask in a dynamic food service environment.
	You will support the team in ensuring smooth office operations, maintaining documentation, and assisting in basic logistical and clerical duties.


Key Responsibilities


	Handle basic clerical and administrative tasks, including filing, photocopying, and record-keeping.
	Run errands such as purchasing office supplies, dispatching documents, or coordinating deliveries.
	Support inventory checks and stock updates for the restaurant.
	Assist with communication between kitchen, service staff, and management.
	Keep the office environment clean, organized, and well-stocked.
	Receive visitors and assist with basic customer or vendor inquiries.
	Handle simple correspondence and report submission as directed.
	Provide ad hoc support to other departments when needed.


Requirements


	SSCE / OND / NCE in any discipline.
	Minimum of 1 year of experience in a similar support role is an advantage.
	Ability to communicate clearly and professionally.
	Trustworthy, punctual, and organized.
	Basic computer knowledge (MS Word/Excel) is an added advantage.
	Willingness to learn and take initiative.
	Resides within Lekki or surrounding areas.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@globalclique.net using "Office Assistant" as the subject of the email.

title: Social Media Manager / Content Creator Job at Ziba Consulting
content:
Ziba Consulting is a dynamic recruitment and consulting firm committed to connecting top talent with the right opportunities. Our mission is to help businesses streamline their hiring processes while supporting job seekers in achieving their career goals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager / Content Creator
Job Location: Lekki Phase I, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time
Work Mode: Hybrid

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are currently seeking a creative and strategic Social Media Manager with strong content creation skills to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will help enhance our digital presence, engage our audience, and position our brand as a leading voice in the HR and recruitment industry.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute a comprehensive social media strategy aligned with business objectives.
	Manage and grow the company’s presence across platforms, including LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter (X), Facebook, and TikTok.
	Create, curate, and schedule high-quality, engaging content (text, images, videos, reels, infographics) tailored to each platform.
	Monitor social and industry trends; implement innovative campaigns to increase brand awareness, engagement, and lead generation.
	Manage paid social advertising campaigns on platforms such as LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram.
	Work with designers, copywriters, and external vendors to develop strong visual and written content.
	Collaborate with the recruitment team to promote job openings, employer branding content, and career development tips.
	Engage actively with followers, respond to comments and inquiries, and build a strong online community.
	Use analytics tools to track and report performance, adjusting strategies for optimal results.
	Stay updated on platform algorithm changes, digital trends, and best practices to maintain a competitive edge.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.
	2–3 years of proven experience as a Social Media Manager or in a similar role, preferably in recruitment, HR, or consulting.
	Strong content creation skills — including experience with graphic design, short-form video editing, and storytelling.
	Proficiency in tools such as Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar content creation platforms.
	Familiarity with social media management tools (e.g., Hootsuite, Buffer).
	Solid understanding of SEO, paid social advertising, and analytics (e.g., Google Analytics, Meta Business Suite, LinkedIn Analytics).
	Excellent copywriting and verbal communication skills.
	Strong attention to detail, creativity, and ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.


Why Join Us?


	Work in a fast-growing recruitment and consulting firm with strong industry impact.
	Shape the digital voice and employer brand of a reputable HR consultancy.
	Collaborative team environment with room for growth and learning.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 per month
